text.p: National Australia Bank Ltd (NAB) said on Tuesday it ceased to be a substantial shareholder in Brisbane-based Metway Bank Ltd on October 18.
NAB held 90,501 converting preference shares in Metway which would convert to about five percent of Metway's ordinary shares.
NAB bought the stake when St George Bank Ltd launched a takeover offer for Metway earlier this year.
NAB, which also holds a 6.8 percent stake in St George, used its stake to block the bid.

St George has since announced plans to merge with Advance Bank Australia Ltd and Metway is involved in a merger with Suncorp Finance and Insurance and Queensland Industry Development Corp (QIDC) sponsored by the Queensland state government.
NAB said it sold the preference shares at A$112 each for a total of A$10.14 million.
